newsitem.title: USA: ADC Telecomm, Siecor settle patent suits.
newsitem.headline: ADC Telecomm, Siecor settle patent suits.

text.p: ADC Telecommunications Inc and Siecor Corp said Monday they settled patent infringement lawsuits in Delaware and North Carolina.
Siecor Corp is owned equally by Siemens AG of Munich, Germany and Corning Inc.
Under terms of the settlement, Siecor has agreed, among other things, to license a U.S. patent assigned to ADC. The licensed technology relates to ADC's fiber distribution frame connector modules.

ADC had alleged infringement of a patent in Delaware. This case has been dismissed. Siecor had challenged the validity of an ADC patent for the fiber distribution frame connector modules in a North Carolina case, and with the issuance of the license by ADC, this case also has been dismissed.

ADC Telecommunications designs, makes and markets transmission and networking systems and broadband connectivity products for fiber optic, copper, coaxial and wireless broadband global networks. The company's products are used by telephone companies and other public network providers.

Siecor develops and makes fiber optic cables, interconnect hardware, connectors, and cable assemblies. Its customers also include regional Bell operating companies and independent telephone companies.
